intro: Rogiera tabascensis, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Rogiera tabascensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
